keywords: Keyword not supported in Linux or macOS versions
Keywords currently not supported by QB64

legacy.description: Legacy QBasic keywords and compatibility items

_ACCEPTFILEDROP.name: _ACCEPTFILEDROP
_ACCEPTFILEDROP.description: turns a program window into a valid drop destination for dragging files from Windows Explorer.
_ACCEPTFILEDROP.example:
_ACCEPTFILEDROP
IF _TOTALDROPPEDFILES > 0 THEN
    FOR i = 1 TO _TOTALDROPPEDFILES
        PRINT _DROPPEDFILE(i)
    NEXT
    _FINISHDROP
END IF

_ACOS.name: _ACOS
_ACOS.description: arccosine function returns the angle in radians based on an input COSine value range from -1 to 1.

_ACOSH.name: _ACOSH
_ACOSH.description: Returns the nonnegative arc hyperbolic cosine of x, expressed in radians.

_ADLER32.name: _ADLER32
_ADLER32.description: Returns the Adler-32 checksum of any arbitrary string.

_ALLOWFULLSCREEN.name: _ALLOWFULLSCREEN
_ALLOWFULLSCREEN.description: allows setting the behavior of the ALT+ENTER combo.

_ALPHA.name: _ALPHA
_ALPHA.description: returns the alpha channel transparency level of a color value used on a screen page or image.

_ALPHA32.name: _ALPHA32
_ALPHA32.description: returns the alpha channel transparency level of a color value used on a 32 bit screen page or image.

_ANDALSO.name: _ANDALSO
_ANDALSO.description: performs short-circuiting logical conjunction on two expressions.

_ARCCOT.name: _ARCCOT
_ARCCOT.description: is the inverse function of the cotangent.

_ARCCSC.name: _ARCCSC
_ARCCSC.description: is the inverse function of the cosecant.

_ARCSEC.name: _ARCSEC
_ARCSEC.description: is the inverse function of the secant.

_ASIN.name: _ASIN
_ASIN.description: Returns the principal value of the arc sine of x, expressed in radians.

_ASINH.name: _ASINH
_ASINH.description: Returns the arc hyperbolic sine of x, expressed in radians.

$ASSERTS.name: $ASSERTS

_ATAN2.name: _ATAN2

_ATANH.name: _ATANH

_BACKGROUNDCOLOR.name: _BACKGROUNDCOLOR

_BASE64ENCODE$.name: _BASE64ENCODE$
_BASE64ENCODE$.description: Encodes a string into Base64 format.

_BIT.name: _BIT

_BIN$.name: _BIN$
_BIN$.description: returns the binary (base 2) STRING representation of the INTEGER part of any value.

_BLEND.name: _BLEND
_BLEND.description: returns -1 if enabled or 0 if disabled by _DONTBLEND statement.

_BLINK.name: _BLINK

_BRIGHTNESS32.name: _BRIGHTNESS32

_BUTTON.name: _BUTTON

_BUTTONCHANGE.name: _BUTTONCHANGE

_BYTE.name: _BYTE
_BYTE.description: can hold signed values from -128 to 127 (one byte or _BIT * 8). Unsigned from 0 to 255.

_CAST.name: _CAST

$CHECKING.name: $CHECKING
$CHECKING.description: turns event and error checking OFF or ON.

_CEIL.name: _CEIL

_CINP.name: _CINP
_CINP.description: Returns a key code from $CONSOLE input

_CLAMP.name: _CLAMP
_CLAMP.description: Forces the given numeric value into a specific range.

_CLEARCOLOR.name: _CLEARCOLOR
_CLEARCOLOR.description: sets a specific color index of an image to be transparent

_CLIP.name: _CLIP
_CLIP.description: allows placement of an image partially off of the screen.

_CLIPBOARD$.name: _CLIPBOARD$
_CLIPBOARD$.description: sets and overwrites the STRING value in the operating system's clipboard.

_CLIPBOARDIMAGE.name: _CLIPBOARDIMAGE
_CLIPBOARDIMAGE.description: copies a valid QB64 image to the clipboard.

$COLOR.name: $COLOR

_COLORCHOOSERDIALOG.name: _COLORCHOOSERDIALOG

_COMMANDCOUNT.name: _COMMANDCOUNT
_COMMANDCOUNT.description: returns the number of arguments passed to the compiled program from the command line.

_CONNECTED.name: _CONNECTED
_CONNECTED.description: returns the status of a TCP/IP connection handle.

_CONNECTIONADDRESS$.name: _CONNECTIONADDRESS$
_CONNECTIONADDRESS$.description: returns a connected user's STRING IP address value using the handle.

$CONSOLE.name: $CONSOLE
$CONSOLE.description: creates a console window that can be used throughout a program.

_CONSOLE.name: _CONSOLE
_CONSOLE.description: used to turn a console window OFF or ON or to designate _DEST _CONSOLE for output.

_CONSOLEINPUT.name: _CONSOLEINPUT
_CONSOLEINPUT.description: fetches input data from a $CONSOLE window to be read later (both mouse and keyboard)

_CONSOLECURSOR.name: _CONSOLECURSOR
_CONSOLECURSOR.description: is used to switch the text cursor in Console Windows off/on or change its size.

_CONSOLEFONT.name: _CONSOLEFONT
_CONSOLEFONT.description: is used to change the text font used in Console Windows or change its size.

_CONSOLETITLE.name: _CONSOLETITLE
_CONSOLETITLE.description: creates the title of the console window using a literal or variable string.

_CONTINUE.name: _CONTINUE

_CONTROLCHR.name: _CONTROLCHR
_CONTROLCHR.description: returns the current state of _CONTROLCHR as 1 when OFF and 0 when ON.

_COPYIMAGE.name: _COPYIMAGE
_COPYIMAGE.description: copies an image handle value to a new designated handle.

_COPYPALETTE.name: _COPYPALETTE
_COPYPALETTE.description: copies the color palette intensities from one 4 or 8 BPP image to another image.

_COT.name: _COT
_COT.description: the mathematical function cotangent defined by 1/TAN.

_COSH.name: _COSH
_COSH.description: Returns the hyperbolic cosine of x radians.

_CRC32.name: _CRC32
_CRC32.description: Returns the Crc-32 checksum of any arbitrary string.

_CSC.name: _CSC
_CSC.description: the mathematical function cosecant defined by 1/SIN.

_CV.name: _CV

_CWD$.name: _CWD$
_CWD$.description: returns the current working directory as a STRING value.

_D2G.name: _D2G
_D2G.description: converts degrees to gradient angle values.

_D2R.name: _D2R
_D2R.description: converts degrees to radian angle values.

$DEBUG.name: $DEBUG
$DEBUG.description: enables debugging features, allowing you to step through your code line by line.

_DECODEURL$.name: _DECODEURL$
_DECODEURL$.description: returns the decoded plain text URL of the given encoded URL.

_DEFAULTCOLOR.name: _DEFAULTCOLOR
_DEFAULTCOLOR.description: returns the current default (text/drawing) color for an image handle or page.

_DEFINE.name: _DEFINE
_DEFINE.description: defines a range of variable names according to their first character as a data type.

_DELAY.name: _DELAY
_DELAY.description: suspends program execution for a SINGLE number of seconds.

_DEPTHBUFFER.name: _DEPTHBUFFER
_DEPTHBUFFER.description: enables, disables, locks or clears depth buffering.

_DESKTOPHEIGHT.name: _DESKTOPHEIGHT
_DESKTOPHEIGHT.description: returns the height of the desktop (not program window).

_DESKTOPWIDTH.name: _DESKTOPWIDTH
_DESKTOPWIDTH.description: returns the width of the desktop (not program window).

_DEST.name: _DEST
_DEST.description: returns the current destination screen page or image handle value.

_DEVICE$.name: _DEVICE$
_DEVICE$.description: returns a STRING expression listing a designated numbered input device name and types of input.

_DEVICEINPUT.name: _DEVICEINPUT
_DEVICEINPUT.description: returns the _DEVICES number of an _AXIS, _BUTTON or _WHEEL event.

_DEVICES.name: _DEVICES
_DEVICES.description: returns the number of input devices found on a computer system including the keyboard and mouse.

_DIR$.name: _DIR$
_DIR$.description: returns common paths in Windows only, like My Documents, My Pictures, My Music, Desktop.

_DIREXISTS.name: _DIREXISTS
_DIREXISTS.description: returns -1 if the Directory folder name string parameter exists. Zero if it does not.

_DISPLAY.name: _DISPLAY
_DISPLAY.description: returns the handle of the current image that is displayed on the screen.

_DISPLAYORDER.name: _DISPLAYORDER
_DISPLAYORDER.description: designates the order to render software, hardware and custom-opengl-code.

_DONTBLEND.name: _DONTBLEND
_DONTBLEND.description: statement turns off default _BLEND 32 bit alpha blending for the current image or screen.

_DONTWAIT.name: _DONTWAIT

_ECHO.name: _ECHO

$ELSE.name: $ELSE
$ELSE.description: used in conjunction with $IF for the precompiler.

$ELSEIF.name: $ELSEIF
$ELSEIF.description: used in conjunction with $IF for the precompiler.

$EMBED.name: $EMBED
$EMBED.description: is used to embed any file's contents into the compiled executable.

_EMBEDDED$.name: _EMBEDDED$
_EMBEDDED$.description: recalls the contents of a file embedded using $EMBED.

$END IF.name: $END IF
$END IF.description: used in conjunction with $IF for the precompiler.

_ENCODEURL$.name: _ENCODEURL$
_ENCODEURL$.description: returns the so called percent encoded representation of the given URL.

_ENVIRONCOUNT.name: _ENVIRONCOUNT
_ENVIRONCOUNT.description: returns the number of key/value pairs currently exist in the environment table.

$ERROR.name: $ERROR
$ERROR.description: used to trigger compiler errors from within the precompiling pass.

_ERRORLINE.name: _ERRORLINE
_ERRORLINE.description: returns the source code line number that caused the most recent runtime error.

_ERRORMESSAGE$.name: _ERRORMESSAGE$
_ERRORMESSAGE$.description: returns a human-readable message describing the most recent runtime error.

$EXEICON.name: $EXEICON
$EXEICON.description: used with a .ICO icon file name to embed the image into the QB64 executable.

_EXIT.name: _EXIT

_FILES$.name: _FILES$
_FILES$.description: returns a file or directory name that matches the specified pattern.

_FINISHDROP.name: _FINISHDROP

_FLOAT.name: _FLOAT

_FONT.name: _FONT
_FONT.description: creates a new font handle from a designated image handle.

_FONTHEIGHT.name: _FONTHEIGHT
_FONTHEIGHT.description: returns the current text or font height.

_FONTWIDTH.name: _FONTWIDTH
_FONTWIDTH.description: returns the current text or font width.

$FORMAT.name: $FORMAT
$FORMAT.description: controls the code formatting behavior in QB64-PE.

_FREEFONT.name: _FREEFONT

_FREEIMAGE.name: _FREEIMAGE

_FREETIMER.name: _FREETIMER

_FULLPATH$.name: _FULLPATH$

_FULLSCREEN.name: _FULLSCREEN

_G2D.name: _G2D
_G2D.description: converts gradient to degree angle values.

_G2R.name: _G2R

_GLRENDER.name: _GLRENDER
_GLRENDER.description: sets whether context is displayed, on top of or behind the software rendering.

_HIDE.name: _HIDE

_HSB32.name: _HSB32
_HSB32.description: returns the 32-bit ARGB color value equivalent to the specified HSB colorspace values.

_HSBA32.name: _HSBA32
_HSBA32.description: returns the 32-bit ARGB color value equivalent to the specified HSB colorspace values + alpha channel.

_HUE32.name: _HUE32
_HUE32.description: returns the hue value (HSB colorspace) of a given 32-bit ARGB color.

_HYPOT.name: _HYPOT
_HYPOT.description: Returns the hypotenuse of a right-angled triangle whose legs are x and y.

$IF.name: $IF
$IF.description: used to set an IF condition for the precompiler.

_ICON.name: _ICON

_IIF.name: _IIF
_IIF.description: provides conditional evaluations similar to a ternary operator, with short-circuiting behavior.

_INCLERRORFILE$.name: _INCLERRORFILE$
_INCLERRORFILE$.description: returns the name of the original source code $INCLUDE module that caused the most recent error.

_INCLERRORLINE.name: _INCLERRORLINE

$INCLUDEONCE.name: $INCLUDEONCE
$INCLUDEONCE.description: prevents that include file contents is injected multiple times into a program.

_INPUTBOX$.name: _INPUTBOX$

_INSTRREV.name: _INSTRREV

_INTEGER64.name: _INTEGER64
_INTEGER64.description: can hold whole numerical values from -9223372036854775808 to 9223372036854775807.

_KEYCLEAR.name: _KEYCLEAR
_KEYCLEAR.description: clears the keyboard buffers for INKEY$, _KEYHIT, and INP.

_KEYHIT.name: _KEYHIT
_KEYHIT.description: returns ASCII one and two byte, SDL Virtual Key and Unicode keyboard key press codes.

_KEYDOWN.name: _KEYDOWN
_KEYDOWN.description: returns whether CTRL, ALT, SHIFT, combinations and other keys are pressed.

$LET.name: $LET
$LET.description: used to set a variable for the precompiler.

_LASTAXIS.name: _LASTAXIS
_LASTAXIS.description: returns the number of axis available on a specified number device listed by _DEVICE$.

_LASTBUTTON.name: _LASTBUTTON
_LASTBUTTON.description: returns the number of buttons available on a specified number device listed by DEVICE$.

_LASTWHEEL.name: _LASTWHEEL
_LASTWHEEL.description: returns the number of scroll wheels available on a specified number device listed by _DEVICE$.

_LIMIT.name: _LIMIT
_LIMIT.description: sets the loops per second rate to slow down loops and limit CPU usage.

_LOADFONT.name: _LOADFONT

_LOADIMAGE.name: _LOADIMAGE

_LOGERROR.name: _LOGERROR
_LOGERROR.description: writes a log message at the Error level with an accompanying stacktrace.

_LOGINFO.name: _LOGINFO
_LOGINFO.description: writes a log message at the Information level.

_LOGMINLEVEL.name: _LOGMINLEVEL
_LOGMINLEVEL.description: returns the current minimum logging level that is being output.

_LOGTRACE.name: _LOGTRACE
_LOGTRACE.description: writes a log message at the Trace level.

_LOGWARN.name: _LOGWARN
_LOGWARN.description: writes a log message at the Warning level.

_MAPTRIANGLE.name: _MAPTRIANGLE
_MAPTRIANGLE.description: maps a triangular image source area to put on a destination area.

_MAPUNICODE.name: _MAPUNICODE
_MAPUNICODE.description: returns the Unicode (UTF32) code point value of a mapped ASCII character code.

_MAX.name: _MAX
_MAX.description: Returns the greater of two given numeric values.

_MD5$.name: _MD5$
_MD5$.description: Returns the MD5 hash value of any arbitrary string.

_MEMFILL.name: _MEMFILL

_MEMFREE.name: _MEMFREE
_MEMFREE.description: frees a designated memory block in a program. Only free memory blocks once.

_MEMGET.name: _MEMGET
_MEMGET.description: returns a value from a designated memory block and OFFSET using a designated variable TYPE.

_MEMIMAGE.name: _MEMIMAGE

_MEMNEW.name: _MEMNEW

_MEMPUT.name: _MEMPUT

_MEMSOUND.name: _MEMSOUND
_MEMSOUND.description: returns a _MEM block referring to a designated sound handle's memory

_MESSAGEBOX.name: _MESSAGEBOX
_MESSAGEBOX.description: Displays a message dialog box, which presents a message to the user.

_MIDDLE.name: _MIDDLE
_MIDDLE.description: centers the program window on the desktop in any screen resolution.

_MIDISOUNDBANK.name: _MIDISOUNDBANK
_MIDISOUNDBANK.description: enables _SNDOPEN to use external FM Banks or SoundFonts when playing MIDI files.

_MIN.name: _MIN
_MIN.description: Returns the lesser of two given numeric values.

_MK$.name: _MK$
_MK$.description: converts a numerical value to a designated ASCII STRING value.

_MOUSEBUTTON.name: _MOUSEBUTTON
_MOUSEBUTTON.description: returns the status of a designated mouse button.

_MOUSEHIDDEN.name: _MOUSEHIDDEN
_MOUSEHIDDEN.description: returns the current state of the mouse pointer.

_MOUSEHIDE.name: _MOUSEHIDE
_MOUSEHIDE.description: hides the mouse pointer from view

_MOUSEINPUT.name: _MOUSEINPUT
_MOUSEINPUT.description: returns a value if the mouse status has changed since the last read.

_MOUSEMOVE.name: _MOUSEMOVE
_MOUSEMOVE.description: moves the mouse pointer to a designated position on the program SCREEN.

_MOUSEMOVEMENTX.name: _MOUSEMOVEMENTX
_MOUSEMOVEMENTX.description: returns the relative horizontal position of the mouse cursor compared to the previous position.

_MOUSEMOVEMENTY.name: _MOUSEMOVEMENTY
_MOUSEMOVEMENTY.description: returns the relative vertical position of the mouse cursor compared to the previous position.

_MOUSESHOW.name: _MOUSESHOW

_MOUSEWHEEL.name: _MOUSEWHEEL
_MOUSEWHEEL.description: returns the number of mouse scroll wheel "clicks" since last read.

_MOUSEX.name: _MOUSEX
_MOUSEX.description: returns the current horizontal position of the mouse cursor.

_MOUSEY.name: _MOUSEY
_MOUSEY.description: returns the current vertical position of the mouse cursor.

_NEGATE.name: _NEGATE
_NEGATE.description: returns True when a boolean evaluation is False and vice-versa.

_NEWIMAGE.name: _NEWIMAGE
_NEWIMAGE.description: creates a designated size program SCREEN or page image and returns a handle value.

$NOPREFIX.name: $NOPREFIX
$NOPREFIX.description: (deprecated) allows QB64-specific keywords to be used without the underscore prefix.

_OFFSET.name: _OFFSET
_OFFSET.description: can be used store the value of an offset in memory when using DECLARE LIBRARY or MEM only.

_OPENCONNECTION.name: _OPENCONNECTION
_OPENCONNECTION.description: open's a connection from a client that the host has detected and returns a status handle.

_OPENFILEDIALOG$.name: _OPENFILEDIALOG$
_OPENFILEDIALOG$.description: Displays a standard dialog box that prompts the user to open a file.

_OPENHOST.name: _OPENHOST
_OPENHOST.description: opens a Host and returns a Host status handle.

OPTION _EXPLICIT.name: OPTION _EXPLICIT
OPTION _EXPLICIT.description: instructs the compiler to require variable declaration with DIM or an equivalent statement.

OPTION _EXPLICITARRAY.name: OPTION _EXPLICITARRAY
OPTION _EXPLICITARRAY.description: instructs the compiler to require array declaration with DIM or an equivalent statement.

_ORELSE.name: _ORELSE
_ORELSE.description: performs short-circuiting inclusive logical disjunction on two expressions.

_OS$.name: _OS$
_OS$.description: returns the QB64 compiler version in which the program was compiled as [WINDOWS], [LINUX] or [MACOSX] and [32BIT] or [64BIT].

_PALETTECOLOR.name: _PALETTECOLOR

_PI.name: _PI

_PIXELSIZE.name: _PIXELSIZE
_PIXELSIZE.description: returns the pixel palette mode of a designated image handle.

_PRESERVE.name: _PRESERVE

_PRINTIMAGE.description: sends an image to the printer that is stretched to the current printer paper size.

_PRINTWIDTH.name: _PRINTWIDTH
_PRINTWIDTH.description: returns the pixel width of a text string to be printed using _PRINTSTRING.

_PUTIMAGE.name: _PUTIMAGE

_R2D.name: _R2D
_R2D.description: converts radians to degree angle values.

_R2G.name: _R2G
_R2G.description: converts radians to gradient angle values.

_RESIZEWIDTH.name: _RESIZEWIDTH
_RESIZEWIDTH.description: returns the requested new user screen width when $RESIZE:ON allows it.

_RGB32.description: returns the LONG 32 bit color value in 32 bit screens only

_RGBA.name: _RGBA

_RGBA32.name: _RGBA32

_ROR.name: _ROR

_SCREENHIDE.name: _SCREENHIDE
_SCREENHIDE.description: hides the program window from view.

_SCREENICON.name: _SCREENICON
_SCREENICON.description: minimizes the program window to an icon on the taskbar.

_SCREENIMAGE.name: _SCREENIMAGE
_SCREENIMAGE.description: creates an image of the current desktop and returns an image handle.

_SCREENMOVE.name: _SCREENMOVE
_SCREENMOVE.description: positions program window on the desktop using designated coordinates or the _MIDDLE option.

_SCREENPRINT.name: _SCREENPRINT
_SCREENPRINT.description: simulates typing text into a Windows program using the keyboard.

$SCREENSHOW.name: $SCREENSHOW
$SCREENSHOW.description: displays the program window after it was hidden.

_SCREENSHOW.name: _SCREENSHOW
_SCREENSHOW.description: displays the program window after it has been hidden by _SCREENHIDE.

_SCREENX.name: _SCREENX
_SCREENX.description: returns the program window's upper left corner horizontal position on the desktop.

_SCREENY.name: _SCREENY
_SCREENY.description: returns the program window's upper left corner vertical position on the desktop.

_SETALPHA.name: _SETALPHA
_SETALPHA.description: sets the alpha channel transparency level of some or all of the pixels of an image.

_SETBIT.name: _SETBIT
_SETBIT.description: is used to set the specified bit of an integer variable to 1.

_SHELLHIDE.name: _SHELLHIDE
_SHELLHIDE.description: returns the code sent by a program exit using END or SYSTEM followed by an INTEGER value.

_SHL.name: _SHL
_SHL.description: used to shift the bits of a numerical value to the left

_SHR.name: _SHR
_SHR.description: used to shift the bits of a numerical value to the right.

_SINH.name: _SINH
_SINH.description: Returns the hyperbolic sine of x radians.

_SMOOTH.name: _SMOOTH
_SMOOTH.description: checks whether the current _FULLSCREEN mode has antialiasing enabled or not.

_SNDBAL.name: _SNDBAL
_SNDBAL.description: attempts to set the balance or 3D position of a sound file.

_SNDCLOSE.name: _SNDCLOSE
_SNDCLOSE.description: frees and unloads an open sound using the sound handle created by _SNDOPEN.

_SNDCOPY.name: _SNDCOPY
_SNDCOPY.description: copies a sound handle value to a new designated handle.

_SNDGETPOS.name: _SNDGETPOS
_SNDGETPOS.description: returns the current playing position in seconds from a sound file.

_SNDLEN.name: _SNDLEN
_SNDLEN.description: returns the length of a sound in seconds from a sound file.

_SNDLIMIT.name: _SNDLIMIT
_SNDLIMIT.description: stops playing a sound after it has been playing for a set number of seconds.

_SNDLOOP.name: _SNDLOOP
_SNDLOOP.description: plays a sound repeatedly until _SNDSTOP is used.

_SNDNEW.name: _SNDNEW
_SNDNEW.description: creates a raw empty sound in memory and returns a LONG handle value for later access.

_SNDOPEN.name: _SNDOPEN
_SNDOPEN.description: loads a sound file and returns a sound handle.

_SNDOPENRAW.name: _SNDOPENRAW
_SNDOPENRAW.description: opens a new channel to shove _SNDRAW content into without mixing.

_SNDPAUSE.name: _SNDPAUSE
_SNDPAUSE.description: stops playing a sound file until resumed.

_SNDPAUSED.name: _SNDPAUSED
_SNDPAUSED.description: returns the current pause status of a sound file handle.

_SNDPLAY.name: _SNDPLAY
_SNDPLAY.description: plays a sound file handle that was created by _SNDOPEN or _SNDCOPY.

_SNDPLAYCOPY.name: _SNDPLAYCOPY
_SNDPLAYCOPY.description: copies a sound handle, plays it and automatically closes the copy when done.

_SNDPLAYFILE.name: _SNDPLAYFILE
_SNDPLAYFILE.description: directly plays a designated sound file.

_SNDPLAYING.name: _SNDPLAYING
_SNDPLAYING.description: returns the current playing status of a sound handle.

_SNDRATE.name: _SNDRATE
_SNDRATE.description: returns the sound card sample rate to set _SNDRAW durations.

_SNDRAW.name: _SNDRAW
_SNDRAW.description: plays a mono or stereo sound sample frame.

_SNDRAWBATCH.name: _SNDRAWBATCH
_SNDRAWBATCH.description: plays a batch of mono or stereo sound sample frames from an array.

_SNDRAWDONE.name: _SNDRAWDONE
_SNDRAWDONE.description: pads a _SNDRAW stream so the final (partially filled) buffer section is played.

_SNDRAWLEN.name: _SNDRAWLEN
_SNDRAWLEN.description: returns a value until the _SNDRAW buffer is empty.

_SNDSETPOS.name: _SNDSETPOS
_SNDSETPOS.description: sets the playing position of a sound handle.

_SNDVOL.name: _SNDVOL
_SNDVOL.description: sets the volume of a sound file handle.

_SOURCE.name: _SOURCE
_SOURCE.description: returns the present source image handle value.

_STARTDIR$.name: _STARTDIR$
_STARTDIR$.description: returns the user's program calling path as a STRING.

_STATUSCODE.name: _STATUSCODE
_STATUSCODE.description: gives the HTTP status code of an HTTP response that was opened using _OPENCLIENT.

_STRCMP.name: _STRCMP
_STRCMP.description: compares the relationship between two strings.

_STRICMP.name: _STRICMP
_STRICMP.description: compares the relationship between two strings, without regard for case-sensitivity.

_TANH.name: _TANH
_TANH.description: Returns the hyperbolic tangent of x radians.

_TITLE.name: _TITLE
_TITLE.description: sets the program title string value.

_TITLE$.name: _TITLE$
_TITLE$.description: gets the program title string value.

_TOGGLEBIT.name: _TOGGLEBIT
_TOGGLEBIT.description: is used to toggle the specified bit of an integer variable from 1 to 0 or 0 to 1.

_TOSTR$.name: _TOSTR$
_TOSTR$.description: Returns the STRING representation of a numerical value. It's a successor of the legacy STR$ function.

_TOTALDROPPEDFILES.name: _TOTALDROPPEDFILES
_TOTALDROPPEDFILES.description: returns the number of items (files or folders) dropped in a program's window after _ACCEPTFILEDROP is enabled.

_UCHARPOS.name: _UCHARPOS
_UCHARPOS.description: calculates the starting pixel positions of every character of a (unicode) text string.

_UFONTHEIGHT.name: _UFONTHEIGHT
_UFONTHEIGHT.description: returns the global glyph height (incl. ascender/descender) of a loaded font.

_ULINESPACING.name: _ULINESPACING
_ULINESPACING.description: returns the vertical line spacing (distance between two consecutive baselines) in pixels.

_UNSIGNED.name: _UNSIGNED
_UNSIGNED.description: expands the positive range of numerical INTEGER, LONG or _INTEGER64 values returned.

$UNSTABLE.name: $UNSTABLE
$UNSTABLE.description: will enable the use of features that have not yet been made a permanent part of the language.

_UPRINTSTRING.name: _UPRINTSTRING
_UPRINTSTRING.description: locates and prints a (unicode) text string using graphic coordinates.

_UPRINTWIDTH.name: _UPRINTWIDTH
_UPRINTWIDTH.description: returns the pixel width of a (unicode) text string to be printed using _UPRINTSTRING.

$VERSIONINFO.name: $VERSIONINFO
$VERSIONINFO.description: adds metadata to Windows only binaries for identification purposes across the OS.

_WAVE.name: _WAVE
_WAVE.description: defines the waveform shape for a specified audio channel when used with SOUND or PLAY.

_WHEEL.name: _WHEEL
_WHEEL.description: returns -1 when a control device wheel is scrolled up and 1 when scrolled down. Zero indicates no activity.

_WIDTH.name: _WIDTH
_WIDTH.description: returns the width of a SCREEN or image handle.

_WINDOWHANDLE.name: _WINDOWHANDLE
_WINDOWHANDLE.description: returns the window handle assigned to the current program by the OS. Windows-only.

_WINDOWHASFOCUS.name: _WINDOWHASFOCUS
_WINDOWHASFOCUS.description: returns true (-1) if the current program's window has focus. Available on Windows and Linux (not macOS).

_WRITEFILE.name: _WRITEFILE
_WRITEFILE.description: directly write a string into a file, without OPEN/CLOSE overhead.

ABS.name: ABS
ABS.description: converts any negative numerical value to a positive value.

ABSOLUTE.name: ABSOLUTE
ABSOLUTE.description: is used to access computer interrupt registers.

ACCESS.name: ACCESS
ACCESS.description: sets the read and write access of a file when opened.

ALIAS.name: ALIAS
ALIAS.description: denotes the actual name of an imported FUNCTION or SUB procedure.

AND.name: AND
AND.description: is used to compare two numerical values bitwise.

AND (boolean).name: AND (boolean)
AND (boolean).description: conditonal operator is used to include another evaluation in an IF...THEN or Boolean statement.

APPEND.name: APPEND
APPEND.description: creates a new file or allows an existing file to have data added using WRITE or PRINT

AS.name: AS
AS.description: is used to denote a variable type or file number.

ASC.name: ASC
ASC.description: (QB64 only) sets the code value of an ASCII text character at a designated string position.

ATN.name: ATN
ATN.description: or arctangent returns the angle in radians of a numerical tangent value.

BEEP.name: BEEP
BEEP.description: creates an error sound of a fixed duration.

BINARY.name: BINARY
BINARY.description: creates or opens an existing file for read and write byte-wise access.

BLOAD.name: BLOAD
BLOAD.description: transfers the contents of a BINARY BSAVE file to a specific array.

BSAVE.name: BSAVE
BSAVE.description: transfers the contents of an array to a specified size BINARY file.

BYVAL.name: BYVAL
BYVAL.description: assigns a numerical variable value by its value, not the name.

CALL.name: CALL
CALL.description: optional statement that sends the program to a SUB procedure. Requires parameters be enclosed in brackets(parenthesis).

CALL ABSOLUTE.name: CALL ABSOLUTE
CALL ABSOLUTE.description: is used to access computer interrupt registers.

CASE.name: CASE
CASE.description: designates specific conditions in a SELECT CASE statement block.

CASE ELSE.name: CASE ELSE
CASE ELSE.description: designates an alternative condition to be evaluated in a SELECT CASE statement block.

CASE IS.name: CASE IS
CASE IS.description: designates specific conditions in a SELECT CASE statement block.

CDBL.name: CDBL
CDBL.description: returns the closest DOUBLE value of a number.

CHAIN.name: CHAIN
CHAIN.description: sends a program to another specified program module or compiled program.

CHDIR.name: CHDIR
CHDIR.description: changes the current program path for file access.

CHR$.name: CHR$
CHR$.description: returns a text string character by the specified ASCII code number.

CINT.name: CINT
CINT.description: returns the closest INTEGER value of a numerical value.

CIRCLE.name: CIRCLE
CIRCLE.description: creates a circle, ellipse or arc at a designated graphical coordinate position.
CIRCLE.example:
CIRCLE (100, 100), 50 ' Circle at (100,100) with radius 50
CIRCLE (200, 200), 30, _RGB32(255, 0, 0) ' Red circle

CLEAR.name: CLEAR
CLEAR.description: sets all variable and array values to zero number values or empty STRINGs.

CLNG.name: CLNG
CLNG.description: returns the closest LONG value of a numerical value.

CLOSE.name: CLOSE
CLOSE.description: closes specific file number(s) or all files when a number is not specified.

CLS.name: CLS
CLS.description: clears a program screen, VIEW port or WINDOW.

COLOR.name: COLOR
COLOR.description: sets the current text foreground and/or background color to be used.
COLOR.example:
COLOR 15, 1 ' White text on blue background
COLOR _RGB32(255, 0, 0) ' Red text

COMMAND$.name: COMMAND$
COMMAND$.description: returns the command line arguments passed when a program is run.

COMMON.name: COMMON
COMMON.description: sets a variable name as shared by CHAINed program modules.

CONST.name: CONST
CONST.description: sets a variable name and its value as a constant value to be used by all procedures.

COS.name: COS
COS.description: returns the cosine of a radian angle value.

CSNG.name: CSNG
CSNG.description: returns the closest SINGLE value of a numerical value.

CSRLIN.name: CSRLIN
CSRLIN.description: returns the present PRINT cursor text row SCREEN coordinate position.

CVD.name: CVD
CVD.description: returns the DOUBLE numerical value of an 8 byte MKD$ string.

CVDMBF.name: CVDMBF
CVDMBF.description: returns the DOUBLE numerical value of a Microsoft Binary Format string.

CVI.name: CVI
CVI.description: returns the INTEGER numerical value of a 2 byte MKI$ string.

CVL.name: CVL
CVL.description: returns the LONG numerical value of a 4 byte MKL$ string.

CVS.name: CVS
CVS.description: returns the SINGLE numerical value of a 4 byte MKS$ string.

CVSMBF.name: CVSMBF
CVSMBF.description: returns the SINGLE numerical value of a Microsoft Binary Format string.

DATA.name: DATA
DATA.description: creates a line of fixed program information separated by commas.

DATE$.name: DATE$
DATE$.description: returns the present Operating System date string formatted as mm-dd-yyyy.

DECLARE LIBRARY (QB64 statement block).name: DECLARE LIBRARY (QB64 statement block)
DECLARE LIBRARY (QB64 statement block).description: declares a C++, SDL or Operating System SUB or FUNCTION to be used.
DECLARE LIBRARY (QB64 statement block).syntax:
DECLARE LIBRARY ["library_file"]
  FUNCTION|SUB name ALIAS "actual_name" (parameters)
END DECLARE

DEF SEG.name: DEF SEG
DEF SEG.description: defines a segment in memory to be accessed by a memory procedure.

DEFDBL.name: DEFDBL
DEFDBL.description: defines a set of undefined variable name starting letters as DOUBLE type numerical values.

DEFINT.name: DEFINT
DEFINT.description: defines a set of undefined variable name starting letters as INTEGER type numerical values.

DEFLNG.name: DEFLNG
DEFLNG.description: defines a set of undefined variable name starting letters as LONG type numerical values.

DEFSNG.name: DEFSNG
DEFSNG.description: defines a set of undefined variable name starting letters as SINGLE type numerical values.

DEFSTR.name: DEFSTR
DEFSTR.description: defines a set of undefined variable name starting letters as STRING type values.

DIM.name: DIM
DIM.description: defines a variable as a specified type and can size a STATIC array.

DO...LOOP.name: DO...LOOP
DO...LOOP.description: sets a recursive procedure loop that can be ignored or exited using conditional arguments.
DO...LOOP.example:
DO
    x = x + 1
LOOP WHILE x < 10

DOUBLE.name: DOUBLE
DOUBLE.description: 8 byte value limited to values up to 15 decimal places.

DRAW.name: DRAW
DRAW.description: uses a special string format that draws graphical lines in specific directions.

$DYNAMIC.name: $DYNAMIC
$DYNAMIC.description: used at the start of a program to set all program arrays as changeable in size using REDIM.

ELSE.name: ELSE
ELSE.description: is used to direct program flow when no other condition is evaluated as true.

ELSEIF.name: ELSEIF
ELSEIF.description: is used with THEN to set alternate conditional evaluations.

END.name: END
END.description: sets the end of a program, sub-procedure, statement block, DECLARE LIBRARY or TYPE definition.

END IF.name: END IF
END IF.description: ENDs an IF...THEN conditional block statement using more than one line of code.

ENVIRON.name: ENVIRON
ENVIRON.description: temporarily sets an environmental key/pair value.

ENVIRON$.name: ENVIRON$
ENVIRON$.description: returns a specified string setting or numerical position as an environmental STRING value.

EOF.name: EOF
EOF.description: returns -1 when a file INPUT or GET has reached the end of a file.

EQV.name: EQV
EQV.description: is used to compare two numerical values bitwise.

ERASE.name: ERASE
ERASE.description: clears the values from $STATIC arrays and completely removes $DYNAMIC arrays.

ERL.name: ERL
ERL.description: returns the closest line number before an error occurred if line numbers are used.

ERR.name: ERR
ERR.description: returns the ERROR code when a program error occurs.

ERROR.name: ERROR
ERROR.description: sets a specific ERROR code to be simulated.

EXIT.name: EXIT
EXIT.description: immediately exits a program FOR...NEXT, DO...LOOP, SUB or FUNCTION procedure.

EXP.name: EXP
EXP.description: returns the value of e to the exponential power specified.

FIELD.name: FIELD
FIELD.description: defines the variable sizes to be written or read from a file.

FILES.name: FILES
FILES.description: returns a list of files in the current directory path to the SCREEN.

FIX.name: FIX
FIX.description: returns the rounded INTEGER value of a numerical value.

FOR...NEXT.name: FOR...NEXT
FOR...NEXT.description: creates a recursive loop procedure that loop a specified number of times.
FOR...NEXT.syntax:
FOR variable = start TO end [STEP increment]
  statements
NEXT [variable]
FOR...NEXT.example:
FOR i = 1 TO 10
    PRINT i
NEXT i

FOR (file statement).name: FOR (file statement)
FOR (file statement).description: used in an OPEN file or device statement to indicate the access mode.

FREE.name: FREE
FREE.description: frees a numbered TIMER event in QB64.

FREEFILE.name: FREEFILE
FREEFILE.description: returns a file number that is currently not in use by the Operating System.

FUNCTION.name: FUNCTION
FUNCTION.description: sub-procedure that can calculate and return one value to a program in its name.
FUNCTION.syntax:
FUNCTION name[(parameters)] [AS type]
  statements
  name = return_value
END FUNCTION

GET.name: GET
GET.description: reads a file sequencially or at a specific position and returns the value as the variable type used.

GET (HTTP statement).name: GET (HTTP statement)
GET (HTTP statement).description: reads the response of an HTTP request that was opened using _OPENCLIENT.

GET (TCP/IP statement).name: GET (TCP/IP statement)
GET (TCP/IP statement).description: reads a TCP/IP connection port to return a value.

GET (graphics statement).name: GET (graphics statement)
GET (graphics statement).description: maps an area the current screen's video information and places it in an INTEGER array.

GOSUB.name: GOSUB
GOSUB.description: sends the program to a designated line label procedure in the main program.

GOTO.name: GOTO
GOTO.description: sends the program to a designated line number or line label in a procedure.

HEX$.name: HEX$
HEX$.description: returns the hexadecimal (base 16) STRING representation of the INTEGER part of any value.

IF...THEN.name: IF...THEN
IF...THEN.description: a conditional block statement used control program flow.
IF...THEN.syntax:
IF condition THEN
  statements
[ELSEIF condition THEN
  statements]
[ELSE
  statements]
END IF
IF...THEN.example:
IF x > 10 THEN
    PRINT "Greater than 10"
ELSE
    PRINT "10 or less"
END IF

IMP.name: IMP
IMP.description: is used to compare two numerical values bitwise.

$INCLUDE.name: $INCLUDE
$INCLUDE.description: designates a text code library file to include with the program.

INKEY$.name: INKEY$
INKEY$.description: ASCII returns a string value entry from the keyboard.

INP.name: INP
INP.description: returns a numerical value from a specified port register address. See Keyboard scancodes

INPUT.name: INPUT
INPUT.description: a user input that returns a value to one or more specified variable(s).

INPUT (file mode).name: INPUT (file mode)
INPUT (file mode).description: OPEN statement that only allows an existing file to be read using INPUT (file statement) or INPUT$.

INPUT (file statement).name: INPUT (file statement)
INPUT (file statement).description: reads a file sequentially using the variable types designated.

INPUT$.name: INPUT$
INPUT$.description: returns a designated number of string bytes from the keyboard entry or a file number.

INSTR.name: INSTR
INSTR.description: returns the position in a text string where a character sequence match starts.

INT.name: INT
INT.description: rounds a numerical value to an INTEGER value by removing the decimal point fraction.

INTERRUPT.name: INTERRUPT
INTERRUPT.description: is used to access computer interrupt registers.

INTERRUPTX.name: INTERRUPTX
INTERRUPTX.description: is used to access computer interrupt registers.

KEY n.name: KEY n
KEY n.description: used with ON KEY(n) events to assign a "softkey" string to a key or create a user defined key.

KEY(n).name: KEY(n)
KEY(n).description: used with ON KEY(n) events to assign, enable, disable or suspend event trapping.

KEY LIST.name: KEY LIST
KEY LIST.description: lists the 12 Function key soft key string assignments going down left side of screen.

KILL.name: KILL
KILL.description: deletes the specified file without a warning. Remove empty folders with RMDIR.

LBOUND.name: LBOUND
LBOUND.description: returns the lower boundary of the specified array.

LCASE$.name: LCASE$
LCASE$.description: returns the lower case value of a STRING.

LEFT$.name: LEFT$
LEFT$.description: returns the specified number of text characters from the left end of a STRING.

LEN.name: LEN
LEN.description: returns the length or number of characters in a STRING value in bytes.

LET.name: LET
LET.description: assigns a variable a literal value. Not required.

LINE.name: LINE
LINE.description: creates a graphic line or box on the SCREEN.
LINE.example:
LINE (0, 0)-(100, 100) ' Diagonal line
LINE (50, 50)-(150, 100), _RGB32(0, 255, 0), BF ' Green filled box

LINE INPUT.name: LINE INPUT
LINE INPUT.description: user input can be any text character including commas and quotes as a STRING value only.

LINE INPUT (file statement).name: LINE INPUT (file statement)
LINE INPUT (file statement).description: returns an entire text file line and returns it as a STRING value.

LIST.name: LIST
LIST.description: displays the current ON KEY(n) function key (F1 to F10) "soft key" settings.

LOC.name: LOC
LOC.description: returns the present file byte position or number of bytes in the OPEN COM buffer.

LOCATE.name: LOCATE
LOCATE.description: sets the text cursor's row and column position for a PRINT or INPUT statement.

LOCK.name: LOCK
LOCK.description: restricts access to portions or all of a file by other programs or processes.

LOF.name: LOF
LOF.description: returns the size of an OPEN file in bytes.

LOG.name: LOG
LOG.description: returns the natural logarithm of a specified numerical value

LOOP.name: LOOP
LOOP.description: bottom end of a recursive DO loop.

LPRINT.name: LPRINT
LPRINT.description: sends STRING data to the default LPT or USB printer.

LPRINT USING.name: LPRINT USING
LPRINT USING.description: sends template formatted text to the default LPT or USB printer.

LSET.name: LSET
LSET.description: left justifies the text in a string so that there are no leading spaces.

LTRIM$.name: LTRIM$
LTRIM$.description: returns a string value with no leading spaces.

MID$.name: MID$
MID$.description: redefines existing characters in a STRING.

MKD$.name: MKD$
MKD$.description: returns an 8 byte ASCII string representation of a DOUBLE numerical value.

MKDIR.name: MKDIR
MKDIR.description: creates a new folder in the current or designated program path.

MKDMBF$.name: MKDMBF$
MKDMBF$.description: returns an 8 byte Microsoft Binary Format STRING representation of a DOUBLE numerical value.

MKI$.name: MKI$
MKI$.description: returns a 2 byte ASCII string representation of an INTEGER.

MKL$.name: MKL$
MKL$.description: returns a 4 byte ASCII string representation of a LONG numerical value.

MKS$.name: MKS$
MKS$.description: returns a 4 byte ASCII string representation of a SINGLE numerical value.

MKSMBF$.name: MKSMBF$
MKSMBF$.description: returns an 8 byte Microsoft Binary Format STRING representation of a DOUBLE numerical value.

MOD.name: MOD
MOD.description: performs integer remainder division on a numerical value.

NAME.name: NAME
NAME.description: names an existing file name AS a new file name.

NEXT.name: NEXT
NEXT.description: bottom end of a FOR...NEXT counter loop to returns to the start or a RESUME NEXT error.

NOT.name: NOT
NOT.description: inverts the value of a logic operation or returns True when a boolean evaluation is False.

OCT$.name: OCT$
OCT$.description: returns the octal (base 8) STRING representation of the INTEGER part of any value.

OFF.name: OFF
OFF.description: turns off all ON event checking.

ON ERROR.name: ON ERROR
ON ERROR.description: sets up and activates an error event checking procedure call. Use to avoid program errors.

ON KEY(n).name: ON KEY(n)
ON KEY(n).description: sets up a keyboard key entry event procedure.

ON STRIG(n).name: ON STRIG(n)
ON STRIG(n).description: sets up a joystick button event procedure call.

ON TIMER(n).name: ON TIMER(n)
ON TIMER(n).description: sets up a timed event procedure call.

ON...GOSUB.name: ON...GOSUB
ON...GOSUB.description: sets up a numerical event procedure call.

ON...GOTO.name: ON...GOTO
ON...GOTO.description: sets up a numerical event procedure call.

OPEN.name: OPEN
OPEN.description: opens a file name for an access mode with a specific file number.

OPEN COM.name: OPEN COM
OPEN COM.description: opens a serial communication port for access at a certain speed and mode.

OPTION BASE.name: OPTION BASE
OPTION BASE.description: can set the lower boundary of all arrays to 1.

OR.name: OR
OR.description: is used to compare two numerical values bitwise.

OR (boolean).name: OR (boolean)
OR (boolean).description: conditonal operator is used to include an alternative evaluation in an IF...THEN or Boolean statement.

OUT.name: OUT
OUT.description: writes numerical data to a specified register port.

OUTPUT.name: OUTPUT
OUTPUT.description: creates a new file or clears all data from an existing file to acess the file sequencially.

PAINT.name: PAINT
PAINT.description: fills an enclosed area of a graphics screen with a color until it encounters a specific colored border.

PALETTE.name: PALETTE
PALETTE.description: sets the Red, Green and Blue color attribute intensities using a RGB multiplier calculation.

PALETTE USING.name: PALETTE USING
PALETTE USING.description: sets the color intensity settings using a designated array.

PCOPY.name: PCOPY
PCOPY.description: swaps two designated memory page images when page swapping is enabled in the SCREEN statement.

PEEK.name: PEEK
PEEK.description: returns a numerical value from a specified segment address in memory.

PLAY.name: PLAY
PLAY.description: returns the number of remaining notes in the background music queue.

PMAP.name: PMAP
PMAP.description: returns the physical or WINDOW view graphic coordinates.

POINT.name: POINT
POINT.description: returns the color attribute number or 32 bit _RGB32 value.

POKE.name: POKE
POKE.description: writes a numerical value to a specified segment address in memory.

POS.name: POS
POS.description: returns the current text column position of the text cursor.

PRESET.name: PRESET
PRESET.description: sets a pixel coordinate to the background color unless one is specified.

PRINT.name: PRINT
PRINT.description: prints text strings or numerical values to the SCREEN.

PRINT (file statement).name: PRINT (file statement)
PRINT (file statement).description: prints text strings or numerical values to a file.

PRINT USING.name: PRINT USING
PRINT USING.description: prints a template formatted string to the SCREEN.

PRINT USING (file statement).name: PRINT USING (file statement)
PRINT USING (file statement).description: prints a template formatted string to a file.

PSET.name: PSET
PSET.description: sets a pixel coordinate to the current color unless a color is designated.

PUT.name: PUT
PUT.description: writes data sequencially or to a designated position using a variable value.

PUT (QB64 TCP/IP statement).name: PUT (QB64 TCP/IP statement)
PUT (QB64 TCP/IP statement).description: sends raw data to a user's connection handle.

PUT (graphics statement).name: PUT (graphics statement)
PUT (graphics statement).description: places pixel data stored in an INTEGER array to a specified area of the SCREEN.

RANDOM.name: RANDOM
RANDOM.description: creates a file or opens an existing file to read and write records of a set byte size.

RANDOMIZE.name: RANDOMIZE
RANDOMIZE.description: sets the random seed value for a specific sequence of random RND values.

RANDOMIZE USING (QB64 statement).name: RANDOMIZE USING (QB64 statement)
RANDOMIZE USING (QB64 statement).description: restarts the designated seed value's random sequence of values from the beginning.

READ.name: READ
READ.description: reads values from a DATA field. ACCESS READ is used with the OPEN statement.

REDIM.name: REDIM
REDIM.description: creates a new dynamic array or resizes one without losing data when _PRESERVE is used.

REM.name: REM
REM.description: or an apostrophe tells the program to ignore statements following it on the same line.

RESET.name: RESET
RESET.description: closes all files and writes the directory information to a diskette before it is removed from a disk drive.

RESTORE.name: RESTORE
RESTORE.description: resets the DATA pointer to the start of a designated field of data.

RESUME.name: RESUME
RESUME.description: an error handling procedure exit that can send the program to a line number or the NEXT code line.

RETURN.name: RETURN
RETURN.description: returns the program to the code immediately following a GOSUB call.

RIGHT$.name: RIGHT$
RIGHT$.description: returns a specific number of text characters from the right end of a STRING.

RMDIR.name: RMDIR
RMDIR.description: removes an empty folder from the current path or the one designated.

RND.name: RND
RND.description: returns a random number value from 0 to .9999999.

RSET.name: RSET
RSET.description: right justifies a string value so that any end spaces are moved to the beginning.

RTRIM$.name: RTRIM$
RTRIM$.description: returns a string with all spaces removed from the right end.

RUN.name: RUN
RUN.description: clears and restarts the program currently in memory or executes another specified program.

SADD.name: SADD
SADD.description: returns the address of a STRING variable as an offset from the current data segment.

SCREEN.name: SCREEN
SCREEN.description: sets the display mode and size of the program window.

SEEK.name: SEEK
SEEK.description: moves to a specified position in an opened file.

SELECT CASE.name: SELECT CASE
SELECT CASE.description: a program flow block that can handle numerous conditional evaluations.
SELECT CASE.syntax:
SELECT CASE expression
  CASE value
    statements
  CASE ELSE
    statements
END SELECT
SELECT CASE.example:
SELECT CASE day
    CASE 1
        PRINT "Monday"
    CASE 2
        PRINT "Tuesday"
    CASE ELSE
        PRINT "Other day"
END SELECT

SGN.name: SGN
SGN.description: returns -1 for negative, 0 for zero, and 1 for positive numerical values.

SHARED.name: SHARED
SHARED.description: designates that a variable can be used by other procedures or the main procedure when in a sub-procedure.

SHELL.name: SHELL
SHELL.description: executes an external command or calls another program. Returns codes sent by END or SYSTEM.

SIN.name: SIN
SIN.description: returns the sine of a radian angle.

SINGLE.name: SINGLE
SINGLE.description: 4 byte floating decimal point values up to 7 decimal places.

SLEEP.name: SLEEP
SLEEP.description: pauses the program for a designated number of seconds or until a key is pressed.

SOUND.name: SOUND
SOUND.description: creates a sound of a specified frequency and duration.

SPACE$.name: SPACE$
SPACE$.description: returns a designated number of spaces to a STRING.

SPC.description: moves the text cursor a number of spaces on the SCREEN.

SQR.name: SQR
SQR.description: returns the square root of a non-negative number.

$STATIC.description: used at the start of a program to set all program arrays as unchangeable in size using DIM.

STEP.name: STEP

SUB.name: SUB
SUB.description: sub-procedure that can calculate and return multiple parameter values.

SWAP.description: swaps two string or numerical values.

TAB.name: TAB

TAN.name: TAN

THEN.name: THEN

TIMER.name: TIMER

TO.name: TO

; Semicolon.name: ; Semicolon
; Semicolon.description: after a PRINT stops invisible cursor at end of printed value. Can prevent screen rolling. A Semicolon after the INPUT prompt text will display a question mark after the text.

, Comma.name: , Comma
, Comma.description: after a PRINT tabs invisible cursor past end of printed value. After the INPUT prompt text a comma displays no Question mark.

\" Quotation mark.name: " Quotation mark
\" Quotation mark.description: designates the ends of a literal STRING value. Use CHR$(34) to insert quotes in a text STRING.

? Question mark.name: ? Question mark
? Question mark.description: is a shortcut substitute for the PRINT keyword. Will change to PRINT when cursor leaves the code line.

' Apostrophe.name: ' Apostrophe
' Apostrophe.description: ignores a line of code or program comment and must be used before a legacy QBasic Metacommand. Same as using REM.

: Colons.name: : Colons
: Colons.description: can be used to separate two procedure statements on one code line.

$ Dollar sign.name: $ Dollar sign
$ Dollar sign.description: used as prefix denotes a legacy QBasic Metacommand, used as suffix it denotes a STRING variable.

( ) Parenthesis.name: ( ) Parenthesis
( ) Parenthesis.description: enclose a math or conditional procedure order, SUB or FUNCTION parameters or to pass by value.

+ Plus.name: + Plus
+ Plus.description: concatenation operator MUST be used to combine literal string values in a variable definition.

_ Underscore.name: _ Underscore
_ Underscore.description: can be used to continue a line of code to the next program line in QB64.

%& _OFFSET.description: QB64 whole numerical pointer address type (any byte size required)

Keyword not supported in Linux or macOS.name: Keyword not supported in Linux or macOS versions
Keyword not supported in Linux or macOS.description: QB64 is meant to be compatible with QB 4.5 or lower versions. PDS (7.1) is not supported. The keywords listed below are currently not supported in QB64. However, older code that uses these keywords won't generate errors, as these are ignored by the compiler.

arc tangent.name: arc tangent
arc tangent.description: The ATN or arctangent function returns the angle in radians of a numerical tangent value.

Metacommands overview.name: Metacommands overview
Metacommands overview.description: Metacommands are commands that start with dollar sign ($). Those commands usually switch the program between different operation modes/behavior or provide extended functionality.

COSine.name: COSine
COSine.description: The COS function returns the horizontal component or the cosine of an angle measured in radians.

Console Windows.name: Console Windows
Console Windows.description: QB64 has console window support using the following QB64 Metacommand or keyword:

Keywords currently not supported by QB64.description: QB64 is meant to be compatible with QB 4.5 or lower versions. PDS (7.1) is not supported. The keywords listed below are currently not supported in QB64. However, older code that uses these keywords won't generate errors, as these are ignored by the compiler.

alpha.name: alpha
alpha.description: The _ALPHA function returns the alpha channel transparency level of a color value used on a screen page or image.

Frequently Asked Questions about QB64.name: Frequently Asked Questions about QB64
Frequently Asked Questions about QB64.description: As with everything else, this list will be updated to correspond to new progress of the QB64 language, so make sure that you are using the latest version of QB64 or in our case QB64-PE, which stands for QB64 Phoenix Edition. Please note that it may take a short time to update this list.

automatic display.name: automatic display
automatic display.description: The _AUTODISPLAY statement enables the automatic display of the screen image changes previously disabled by _DISPLAY.

string.name: string
string.description: STRING variables or literal values are one byte per character length text or ASCII characters.

boolean.name: boolean
boolean.description: Boolean statements are evaluations that return true (-1) or false (0) values. This are for instance the Relational Operations, but also functions such as _FILEEXISTS, EOF, _SCREENEXISTS etc. return those values when checking for certain conditions. The results of those evaluations or function calls can be used in other mathematical or logical operations.

font.name: font
font.description: The _FONT statement sets the current _LOADFONT function font handle to be used by PRINT.

array.name: array
array.description: Arrays are simply variables with a number of elements that can each hold data in memory. To designate a certain element, integers denote the value's position in memory. Don't let talk about memory scare you! Basic does all of the work for you just by using the simple commands in this tutorial. Besides that, you have already been using memory since you created your first variable!

MEM.name: MEM
MEM.description: The _MEM variable type can be used when working with memory blocks. It has no variable type suffix.

DEVICE$.name: DEVICE$
DEVICE$.description: The _DEVICE$ function returns a STRING value holding the controller type, name and input types of the input devices on a computer.

ALPHA.name: ALPHA
ALPHA.description: The _ALPHA function returns the alpha channel transparency level of a color value used on a screen page or image.

Unicode.name: Unicode
Unicode.description: CP437 is the character set of the original IBM PC. It is also known as DOS-US, OEM-US or IBM Extended character set. They also may erroneously be referred to as the OEM font, Extended ASCII or High ASCII.

DECLARE LIBRARY.name: DECLARE LIBRARY
DECLARE LIBRARY.description: The DECLARE LIBRARY declaration allows for the utilization of external library SUB and FUNCTION procedures.

circle.name: circle
circle.description: The CIRCLE statement is used in graphic SCREEN modes to create circles, arcs or ellipses.

IF.name: IF
IF.description: IF...THEN statements make boolean (true or false) evaluations to automate program decision making.

tangent.name: tangent
tangent.description: The TAN function returns the ratio of SINe to COSine or tangent value of an angle measured in radians.

Microsoft Binary Format.name: Microsoft Binary Format
Microsoft Binary Format.description: The MKDMBF$ function encodes a double-precision IEEE number to a string value in the Microsoft Binary format.

SINe.name: SINe
SINe.description: The SIN function returns the vertical component or sine of an angle measured in radians.

CHAINed.name: CHAINed
CHAINed.description: CHAIN is used to change seamlessly from one module to another one in a program.

screen.name: screen
screen.description: The SCREEN statement sets the video display mode and size of the program window's workspace.

STRINGs.name: STRINGs
STRINGs.description: STRING variables or literal values are one byte per character length text or ASCII characters.

segment.name: segment
segment.description: The memory segment is the hexadecimal byte address in relation to a segment register.

ERROR code.name: ERROR code
ERROR code.description: This page lists all the error codes defined in QB64 that can occur in a program when running. Unless overridden with an ON ERROR handler, these result in a dialog box appearing. Due to legacy holdovers from previous BASIC dialects, not all of these errors may actually occur in a program (unless manually triggered with ERROR).

opened.name: opened
opened.description: The OPEN statement is used to open a file or COM serial communications port for program input or output.

ENDs.name: ENDs
ENDs.description: The END statement terminates a program without an immediate exit or ends a procedure or statement block.

RESUME NEXT.name: RESUME NEXT
RESUME NEXT.description: The RESUME statement is used with NEXT or a line number or label in an error handling routine.

dynamic.name: dynamic
dynamic.description: The $DYNAMIC metacommand allows the creation of dynamic (resizable) arrays.

strings.name: strings
strings.description: STRING variables or literal values are one byte per character length text or ASCII characters.

whole.name: whole
whole.description: INTEGER is a 2-byte number type definition that can hold whole numerical values.

Metacommand.name: Metacommand
Metacommand.description: Metacommands are commands that start with dollar sign ($). Those commands usually switch the program between different operation modes/behavior or provide extended functionality.

Relational Operations.name: Relational Operations
Relational Operations.description: QB64 supports several relational operations, which are binary operations that test numeric or string values and return an INTEGER value representing a boolean true (-1) or false (0) result. These operations are primarily used in expressions where a condition is required, such as the IF...THEN statement.

concatenation.name: concatenation
concatenation.description: Concatenation is a process where literal or variable STRING values are combined using the + operator.

Question mark.name: Question mark
Question mark.description: A question mark can be used as a substitute shortcut to typing PRINT when creating code.

comma.name: comma
comma.description: The comma is used to TAB the cursor after a PRINT statement's text to tab append another printed value.

Semicolon.name: Semicolon
Semicolon.description: The semicolon is used in a PRINT statement to stop the screen print cursor immediately after the printed value.

VARIABLE_TYPES_COMPREHENSIVE.name: VARIABLE_TYPES_COMPREHENSIVE
VARIABLE_TYPES_COMPREHENSIVE.description: Comprehensive reference for all QB64PE variable types, sigils, memory sizes, and patterns
VARIABLE_TYPES_COMPREHENSIVE.syntax: DIM variable AS type | DIM variableSigil
VARIABLE_TYPES_COMPREHENSIVE.example: DIM name$ AS STRING, DIM count% AS INTEGER, DIM AS LONG value1, value2

dim_patterns.multiple_same_type: DIM AS type var1, var2, var3
dim_patterns.multiple_mixed_types: DIM AS type1 var1, AS type2 var2, AS type3 var3
dim_patterns.arrays_multi_dim: DIM array(x, y, z) AS type
dim_patterns.arrays_with_bounds: DIM array(0 TO 10, 1 TO 20) AS type
examples: DIM AS INTEGER foo, bar, baz
DIM AS LONG count, total, sum
DIM AS DOUBLE x, y, z
DIM AS STRING name, address, city

unsigned_convention.benefits: Doubles positive range, useful for counters and indices

optimization_tips: Use smaller types when range permits
Consider unsigned types for positive-only values
_BYTE arrays use 8x less memory than _INTEGER64 arrays
STRING * fixed length can be more efficient than variable strings

performance_characteristics.notes: Smaller types improve cache performance but may have conversion overhead
